content.description: You start on a good side pull on your right and a sharp undercling on your left. Bump up to a juggy side pull on your right and continue up the well featured face with good feet to the top.A much harder sit start is possible as well.
content.location:
From the underpass walk up the path until you reach a turn. Continuing straight instead of turning will lead you right up a creek bed. Go up the creek bed 30 yards and on your left is an obvious trail around the trout pond. If it had rained on the recent days this path will likely have a small brook running through it. Continue down the short path and it will lead directly to the breeding pool Boulder. 

 The route described is on the side opposite the highway. located on a well featured quartz arete.

content.description: Find the logical start, figure out a way to the jug about half way up and top it out... This was my first ever rock climb, I was brought here by WMS
content.location: Right after the arete on the right.

content.description: Start on an obvious right hand side pull and a left hand gaston. Find somewhat iffy feet and reach for small crimp. Next reach far to the obvious small jug (crux). After matching the small jug traverse left to top out.
content.location:
From the underpass walk up the path until you reach a turn. Continuing straight instead of turning will lead you right up a creek bed. Go up the creek bed 30 yards and on your left is an obvious trail around the trout pond. If it had rained in the recent days this path will likely have a small brook running through it. Continue down the short path and it will lead directly to the breeding pool Boulder.

 The route described is on the side opposite the highway. located right of the well featured quartz arete. To the right of Juneau.

content.description: Start as far left as you can before things get wet, traverse on good slopers as the feet go away you reach the rounded arete. find a way around this thing (crux) then top it out.   .   .   .
content.location: the first line you see when approaching.

content.description: By the trout breeding pond is a long but shorter boulder. Drys fairly fast after a rain and has some good routes.
